q1_text: What frustrates you most about your relationship with sugar?
q1_option_hardToResist: I know I should eat less but it's hard to resist
q1_option_goToComfort: Sugar is my go-to for comfort or energy
q1_option_keepTellingCutBack: I keep telling myself I'll cut back, but never do
q1_help_hardToResist: You're not alone in this struggle! Learn simple strategies to make resisting easier by understanding your triggers and building healthier habits.
q1_help_goToComfort: Find better energy sources! Explore healthier alternatives that truly comfort and energize you without the sugar crash.
q1_help_keepTellingCutBack: Turn intention into action! Learn practical steps to finally follow through on your commitment to cut back on sugar.
q2_text: How do you typically feel after eating sugar?
q2_option_regretful: I feel regretful and wish I hadn't eaten it
q2_option_crashSlugglish: I feel fine at first, but then crash and feel sluggish
q2_option_moreCravings: It triggers more cravings and I want even more
q2_help_regretful: Transform regret into awareness! Learn to recognize patterns before they happen and build the skills to make choices you'll feel good about.
q2_help_crashSlugglish: Break free from the energy rollercoaster! Discover how to maintain stable energy throughout the day without relying on sugar spikes.
q2_help_moreCravings: End the craving cycle! Understand why sugar triggers more cravings and learn effective strategies to break this addictive pattern.
q3_text: Which area of your life has been most affected by your sugar habits?
q3_option_relationships: My relationships with food and eating
q3_help_confidence: Rebuild your self-worth! Discover how conquering sugar can restore confidence and transform how you see yourself.
q3_help_energyMood: Reclaim your vitality! Learn how stable blood sugar leads to consistent energy and balanced emotions throughout the day.
q3_help_healthAppearance: Transform from the inside out! Experience the visible and invisible health improvements that come with reducing sugar.
q3_help_relationships: Heal your relationship with food! Create a peaceful, balanced approach to eating that serves your wellbeing.
q4_text: When do you most struggle with sugar cravings?
q4_option_sadLonely: When I'm feeling sad or lonely
q4_help_stressed: Stress relief without the sugar crash! Learn powerful coping strategies that actually reduce stress instead of adding to it.
q4_help_sadLonely: Emotional comfort that truly heals! Discover healthier ways to soothe difficult feelings and build emotional resilience.
q4_help_lateNight: Break the late-night sugar cycle! Discover healthy evening routines and alternatives that satisfy you without the sugar crash.
q4_help_boredProcrastinating: Turn boredom into breakthrough! Replace mindless snacking with engaging activities that energize and motivate you.
q6_text: What's the biggest consequence you've experienced from sugar consumption?
q6_option_physicalSymptoms: Physical symptoms that interfere with my day
q6_option_avoidingSocial: Avoiding social situations because of my eating habits
q6_option_notReachingPotential: Feeling like I'm not living up to my potential
q6_help_disappointed: End the disappointment cycle! Learn how to set achievable goals and celebrate progress that builds lasting self-respect.
q6_help_physicalSymptoms: Reclaim your physical wellbeing! Address the root cause and watch troublesome symptoms improve as you reduce sugar.
q6_help_avoidingSocial: Reconnect with confidence! Learn strategies to enjoy social situations without compromising your health or happiness.
q6_help_notReachingPotential: Unleash your true potential! Discover how conquering sugar unlocks energy, focus, and motivation you didn't know you had.

consumption_whyDoWeAskContent: We ask about your sugar consumption habits to help personalize your journey and show you the potential impact of making a change. This information helps us create a more effective plan for you.
insights_subtitle: Stick with it and you could get:
insights_disclaimer_estimate: Estimates based on your pattern. Actual results vary.
insights_cmp_weightLoss: That's like dropping a jeans size every month
insights_cmp_sleep: Wake up feeling refreshed, not groggy
q7_text: How would you feel if you had complete control over sugar cravings?
q7_option_proudConfident: Proud and confident in my self-discipline
q7_option_freeLiberated: Free and liberated from constant mental battles
q7_option_excitedGoals: Excited about reaching my health goals
q7_option_calmPeaceful: Calm and at peace with my food choices
q7_help_proudConfident: That pride is within reach! Build unshakeable confidence through proven strategies that strengthen your self-discipline daily.
q7_help_freeLiberated: Freedom awaits! Break free from the mental exhaustion of constant cravings and reclaim your headspace for what matters.
q7_help_excitedGoals: Your excitement is contagious! Channel that energy into concrete steps that bring your health goals closer every day.
q7_help_calmPeaceful: That peace is possible! Develop a calm, balanced relationship with food that feels natural and effortless.
q8_text: What would achieving your sugar goals mean to you personally?
q8_option_provingCommitment: Proving to myself that I can stick to my commitments
q8_option_settingExample: Setting a good example for my family/loved ones
q8_option_comfortableInSkin: Finally feeling comfortable in my own skin
q8_option_energyForDreams: Having the energy to pursue my dreams
q8_help_provingCommitment: Your word to yourself matters! Build unbreakable self-trust through small wins that prove your incredible commitment power.
q8_help_settingExample: Lead by example! Your journey inspires others and creates a ripple effect of positive change in your family's health.
q8_help_comfortableInSkin: That comfort is your birthright! Discover how conquering sugar brings the self-acceptance you've been searching for.
q8_help_energyForDreams: Dreams need energy to become reality! Unlock the sustained vitality that fuels your biggest aspirations and goals.
q9_text: How do you typically handle social situations with sugary foods?
q9_option_giveInDifficult: I give in to avoid making things awkward
q9_option_anxiousUncomfortable: I feel anxious and uncomfortable the whole time
q9_option_stickGoalsLeftOut: I stick to my goals but feel left out
q9_help_giveInDifficult: Your health isn't difficult - it's essential! Learn confident ways to prioritize your wellbeing without feeling awkward or apologetic.
q9_help_avoidSituations: Don't miss out on life! Discover strategies to enjoy social gatherings while maintaining your sugar-free commitment with confidence.
q9_help_anxiousUncomfortable: Turn anxiety into confidence! Master social situations with calm, effective strategies that keep you comfortable and committed.
q9_help_stickGoalsLeftOut: Belong while staying true to yourself! Learn how to feel included and connected while honoring your health commitments.
q10_text: How do you currently see yourself in relation to sugar?
q10_option_tryingStruggling: As someone who's trying but struggling
q10_option_journeyImprovement: As someone who's on a journey of improvement
q10_option_needsToolsSupport: On the right track, just need extra tools and support
q10_help_lacksWillpower: You have more willpower than you think! Discover how to tap into your inner strength and build unshakeable self-control.
q10_help_tryingStruggling: Your effort is already victory! Transform that struggle into success with proven strategies that actually work.
q10_help_journeyImprovement: Perfect mindset for lasting change! Continue your growth journey with tools that accelerate your progress and success.
q10_help_needsToolsSupport: You know what you need - that's wisdom! Get the exact tools and support system designed for your success.
q11_text: What kind of support would make the biggest difference for you?
q11_option_understandingWhy: Understanding why I crave sugar in the first place
q11_option_momentTools: Get healthy alternatives to my sugary foods
q11_option_connectingOthers: Connecting with others who understand my struggle
q11_option_trackingProgress: Tracking my progress to stay motivated
q11_help_understandingWhy: Knowledge brings freedom! Uncover the root causes behind your cravings and gain the power to address them effectively.
q11_help_momentTools: Be prepared when cravings strike! Get instant healthy food alternatives that satisfy your cravings without the sugar.
q11_help_connectingOthers: Community changes everything! Connect with people who truly understand your journey and cheer you on to success.
q11_help_trackingProgress: See your wins add up! Visual progress tracking keeps you motivated and celebrates every step forward on your journey.
q12_text: How did you know about STOPPR?
q12_help_tiktok: Great! We'll provide content similar to what you've seen on TikTok to keep you engaged and motivated.
q12_help_instagram: Perfect! Our visual approach to tracking progress will feel familiar to your Instagram experience.
q12_help_google: Excellent! We'll provide the comprehensive information and resources you're looking for.
q12_help_youtube: Awesome! We'll include video content to help you on your sugar-free journey.
q12_help_friendFamily: Wonderful! Community support is important, and we'll help you connect with others on this journey.
q12_help_other: Thanks for joining us! We're glad you found STOPPR and are ready to help you reduce your sugar intake.

q13_help_female: We'll customize your experience to address hormonal fluctuations and other factors specific to women.

rewiringBenefits_title: Read what top experts & influencers say:
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_andrew_titl: The Science of Breaking Sugar Addiction
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_andrew_desc: Processed sugar hijacks your dopamine pathways, creating addiction-like patterns. Understanding the neuroscience behind cravings is the first step to freedom.
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_lizzo_title: Self-Love Means Ditching What Doesn't Serve You
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_lizzo_descr: Real self-care isn't just bubble bathsâ€”it's saying no to processed sugar that makes you crash. Your body deserves better, and so do you!
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_demi_title: Recovery Includes Breaking All Harmful Patterns
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_demi_descri: Part of my healing journey was recognizing how sugar was another way I was numbing emotions. Breaking free from processed sugar gave me real clarity.
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_alicia_titl: No More Sugar, Just Pure Energy and Clarity
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_alicia_desc: Ditching sugar boosted my focus and stamina. No crashes, just steady energy all dayâ€”feeling unstoppable!
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_harvey_titl: Sugar-Free and Loving the Health Perks
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_harvey_desc: My skin's clearer, and I've lost 8 lbs since quitting sugar. Mood swings are goneâ€”life's so much brighter!
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_allison_tit: Ditched Sugar, Gained a Healthier Me
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_allison_des: Quitting sugar slashed my cravings and fatigue. My digestion's smooth, and I'm strongerâ€”life's so much better!
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_tess_descri: Sleep's deeper, and my mind's sharper without sugar. Dropped the bloat and feel lighter every dayâ€”amazing!
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_anonymous_t: Health Soars After Dropping Sugar Habit
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_anonymous_d: No sugar, no problemâ€”energy's up, joints feel better, and I'm glowing. Quitting was worth every second!
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_myriam_titl: Health Soars After Dropping Sugar Habit
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_myriam_desc: No sugar, no problemâ€”energy's up, joints feel better, and I'm glowing. Quitting was worth every second!
rewiringBenefits_testimonial_alessandro_: Cutting sugar improved my workouts and mood. Less fatigue, more strengthâ€”my body's thriving now!

stopprScienceBackedPlan_harvard_quote: "Habits form through repeated actions in stable contexts, taking weeks to months to become automatic."
stopprScienceBackedPlan_harvard_source: Wood, W., & RÃ¼nger, D. (2016). Psychology of Habit. Annual Review of Psychology.
stopprScienceBackedPlan_ucl_quote: "96 participants performed a daily behavior, and automaticity was modeled to plateau at an average of 90 days, with a range of 18-254 days."
stopprScienceBackedPlan_ucl_source: Lally, P., et al. (2010). How are habits formed: Modelling habit formation in the real world. European Journal of Social Psychology.
stopprScienceBackedPlan_atomicHabits_quo: "On average, it takes more than three months before a new behavior becomes automaticâ€”90 days to be exact."
stopprScienceBackedPlan_atomicHabits_sou: Clear, J. (2018). Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones. Avery.

ratings_testimonial_jacob_review: I never thought I'd quit sugar, but STOPPR's simple design and timely reminders proved me wrong. Community support helps a lot. I'd love more recipes, but it's still a fantastic tool for cutting back!
ratings_testimonial_emily_review: STOPPR really gets it! It guides you off sugar with step-by-step challenges and rewarding progress charts. My energy has soared since startingâ€”I'm so impressed. Must-try app for sugar quitters!
ratings_testimonial_mark_review: STOPPR is the best app to ditch sugar completely! It acts like a coach, revealing hidden sugars and keeping me motivated. Two months in, I've lost weight and feel sharperâ€”can't recommend it enough!

homeRewire_motivationalText: Today marks the beginning of a powerful journey. This decision is a commitment to a better you. Remember, small steps lead to great changes.
homeRewire_benefit_confidence_descriptio: As you distance yourself from sugar, you'll gradually notice improved confidence, particularly in social situations and interactions with others.
homeRewire_benefit_esteem_description: With time, overcoming sugar addiction can lead to a more positive self-image and higher self-esteem, as you regain control over your life.
homeRewire_benefit_clarity_description: After quitting sugar, many people report a noticeable improvement in mental clarity, focus, and cognitive function within a couple of months.
homeRewire_benefit_energy_description: As your body and mind recover, you may experience a healthier energy level and improved overall vitality after around 30-45 days.
homeRewire_benefit_thoughts_description: Quitting sugar allows for the development of healthier, more realistic perceptions of food and relationships, which generally becomes evident after a few months.

challengeScreen_initialScreen_text: Are you ready to start the challenge? By committing to 28 days of abstinence from sugar, you'll give your brain the chance to reset its addictive patterns and restore balance to your dopamine receptors. This is your opportunity to break free and reclaim control!

thinkingRelapsing_cravingTimerSubtitle: Hang in there! Most cravings pass in 5 minutes
thinkingRelapsing_redText1: Sugar can cause emotional instability and lack of energy.
thinkingRelapsing_redText2: Consuming sugar elevates your risk of chronic diseases.
thinkingRelapsing_redText3: Sugar cravings are temporary, but health is forever.
thinkingRelapsing_redText4: Sugar feeds inflammation in your body and brain.
thinkingRelapsing_redText5: Giving in to sugar now creates stronger cravings later.
thinkingRelapsing_redText6: Sugar disrupts your gut microbiome and digestive health.
thinkingRelapsing_redText7: Sugar crashes make you feel worse than before eating it.
thinkingRelapsing_redText8: Your future self will thank you for saying no to sugar.
thinkingRelapsing_redText9: Sugar can accelerate aging and skin problems.
thinkingRelapsing_redText10: Sugar derails your progress and weakens your willpower.
thinkingRelapsing_redText11: Each sugar craving defeated makes you mentally stronger.
thinkingRelapsing_redText12: Sugar hides in processed foods and sabotages health goals.
thinkingRelapsing_redText13: Sugar addiction works like other harmful dependencies.
thinkingRelapsing_redText14: Sugar increases anxiety and worsens mood disorders.
thinkingRelapsing_redText15: Regular sugar consumption leads to insulin resistance.
thinkingRelapsing_redText16: Sugar temporarily numbs emotions without solving problems.
thinkingRelapsing_redText17: Sugar provides empty calories with no nutritional value.
thinkingRelapsing_redText18: Sugar can trigger brain fog and decreased mental clarity.
thinkingRelapsing_redText19: Sugar consumption is linked to poor sleep quality.
thinkingRelapsing_redText20: Breaking the sugar cycle requires strength you already have.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText1: Resisting sugar empowers you to take control of your health.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText2: Every time you say no to sugar, you're saying yes to health.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText3: Your commitment to a sugar-free life gets stronger each day.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText4: Natural foods provide sustainable energy without the crash.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText5: The discomfort of withdrawal is temporary, the benefits last.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText6: Your body is healing itself with each sugar-free day.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText7: Moment by moment, you're rebuilding your relationship with food.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText8: Clarity and energy improve the longer you avoid sugar.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText9: Choosing health over momentary pleasure builds character.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText10: Your taste buds will adjust and crave natural sweetness instead.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText11: The freedom from sugar addiction is worth the challenge.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText12: Every craving defeated is a victory for your future self.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText13: You deserve the vitality that comes from a sugar-free lifestyle.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText14: True satisfaction comes from nourishing your body properly.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText15: Your health journey inspires others around you.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText16: Mindful eating creates a positive relationship with food.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText17: Each day sugar-free strengthens your mind-body connection.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText18: You are stronger than any craving you face.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText19: Breaking free from sugar allows you to taste life more fully.
thinkingRelapsing_whiteText20: The best version of yourself exists beyond sugar dependence.
thinkingRelapsing_tip1:
SUGAR CRAVINGS are the BIGGEST
reason why people gain WEIGHT.

FIGHT THEM OFF with:
â€¢ Salt & electrolyte water
â€¢ Pickle juice
â€¢ Salt on the tongue
â€¢ Lemon/lime/grapefruit juice
â€¢ Gum: Use it for cravings from time to time

Watch your sugar cravings VANISH.
thinkingRelapsing_tip2:
CRAVING SUGAR? Your body might be
needing MINERALS and HYDRATION.

TRY THESE INSTEAD:
â€¢ Drink 16oz of water with sea salt
â€¢ Eat a savory protein snack
â€¢ Take a 5-minute walk
â€¢ Chew a piece of cinnamon gum
â€¢ Brush your teeth

Cravings typically pass in 15 MINUTES.
thinkingRelapsing_tip3:
SUGAR ADDICTION works through
the same brain pathways as drugs.

BREAK THE CYCLE with:
â€¢ High-protein meals
â€¢ Healthy fats like avocado
â€¢ Chromium-rich foods (broccoli, grapes)
â€¢ Cinnamon tea (regulates blood sugar)
â€¢ 10 deep breaths when cravings hit

Each CRAVING DEFEATED rewires your brain.
thinkingRelapsing_tip4:
When SUGAR CRAVINGS hit,
your blood sugar is likely UNSTABLE.

STABILIZE IT with:
â€¢ Apple slices with almond butter
â€¢ A handful of nuts with berries
â€¢ Coconut oil in herbal tea
â€¢ Fermented foods (kombucha, kimchi)
â€¢ A hard-boiled egg

STEADY BLOOD SUGAR = STEADY MOOD.
thinkingRelapsing_tip5:
EMOTIONAL EATING often triggers
SUGAR CRAVINGS and BINGES.

INTERRUPT THE PATTERN:
â€¢ Name the emotion you're feeling
â€¢ Drink a cup of mint or ginger tea
â€¢ Call a supportive friend
â€¢ Do 20 jumping jacks
â€¢ Write down why you're avoiding sugar

PAUSE before you consume.
thinkingRelapsing_tip6:
TIRED ALL THE TIME? Sugar might
be DRAINING your energy reserves.

BOOST ENERGY naturally:
â€¢ Eat protein every 3-4 hours
â€¢ Take a B-vitamin complex
â€¢ Try a spoonful of MCT oil
â€¢ Cold shower for 30 seconds
â€¢ Green tea instead of sugar

REAL ENERGY doesn't crash like sugar does.
thinkingRelapsing_tip7:
SUGAR WITHDRAWAL symptoms
peak at 2-3 days and fade after a week.

GET THROUGH IT with:
â€¢ L-glutamine supplement
â€¢ Extra magnesium (reduces cravings)
â€¢ Bone broth with sea salt
â€¢ Green vegetable juices
â€¢ Distract with a favorite hobby

It gets EASIER every day you resist.
thinkingRelapsing_tip8:
Your GUT MICROBIOME changes when
you quit sugar, improving health dramatically.

SUPPORT YOUR GUT:
â€¢ Probiotic foods (yogurt, sauerkraut)
â€¢ Prebiotic fiber (onions, garlic, bananas)
â€¢ Apple cider vinegar in water
â€¢ Limit artificial sweeteners
â€¢ Drink chamomile tea

HEALTHY GUT = FEWER CRAVINGS.
thinkingRelapsing_tip9:
HUNGER isn't always what drives
SUGAR CRAVINGS. Often it's HABIT.

CHANGE YOUR ROUTINES:
â€¢ Rearrange your kitchen
â€¢ Take a different route past temptations
â€¢ Create a new after-meal ritual
â€¢ Drink sparkling water with lime
â€¢ Keep hands busy with a stress ball

NEW HABITS CREATE NEW OUTCOMES.
thinkingRelapsing_tip10:
STRESS HORMONES trigger
SUGAR CRAVINGS intensely.

LOWER STRESS with:
â€¢ 4-7-8 breathing: inhale for 4, hold 7, exhale 8
â€¢ Progressive muscle relaxation
â€¢ Lavender essential oil
â€¢ 5-minute meditation
â€¢ 30-second cold exposure

CALM MIND = CONTROLLED CRAVINGS.
thinkingRelapsing_tip11:
POOR SLEEP makes sugar cravings
300% STRONGER the next day.

OPTIMIZE SLEEP with:
â€¢ Blackout curtains
â€¢ No screens 1 hour before bed
â€¢ Magnesium glycinate supplement
â€¢ Consistent sleep/wake times
â€¢ Bedroom temperature at 65-68Â°F

QUALITY SLEEP is your anti-craving superpower.
thinkingRelapsing_tip12:
SWEET TOOTH acting up?
Your taste buds can be RETRAINED.

ADJUST YOUR PALATE with:
â€¢ Cinnamon, vanilla, and nutmeg
â€¢ Roasted sweet vegetables
â€¢ Fresh berries (lowest sugar fruits)
â€¢ Dark chocolate (85%+ cacao)
â€¢ Herbal teas with sweet notes

After 2 WEEKS, fruit will taste like candy.
thinkingRelapsing_tip13:
NUTRIENT DEFICIENCIES often
masquerade as SUGAR CRAVINGS.

REPLENISH with:
â€¢ Zinc (oysters, pumpkin seeds)
â€¢ Chromium (broccoli, grapes)
â€¢ Magnesium (dark leafy greens)
â€¢ B vitamins (meat, eggs, nutritional yeast)
â€¢ Vitamin D (sunshine, fatty fish)

FEED YOUR BODY what it ACTUALLY needs.
thinkingRelapsing_tip14:
DOPAMINE HITS from sugar keep you
coming back for more like an addiction.

FIND HEALTHIER DOPAMINE SOURCES:
â€¢ 10 minutes of exercise
â€¢ Cold shower
â€¢ Listen to favorite music
â€¢ Accomplish a small task
â€¢ Spend time in nature

NATURAL REWARDS are more SUSTAINABLE.
thinkingRelapsing_tip15:
DEHYDRATION mimics hunger and
increases SUGAR CRAVINGS dramatically.

HYDRATE STRATEGICALLY:
â€¢ Start day with 16oz water
â€¢ Add electrolytes (sodium, potassium)
â€¢ Drink before meals
â€¢ Herbal teas throughout day
â€¢ Eat water-rich vegetables

75% of Americans are CHRONICALLY DEHYDRATED.
thinkingRelapsing_tip16:
The FIRST 5 SECONDS of a craving
are when willpower can win.

CRAVING EMERGENCY KIT:
â€¢ Keep sugar-free gum handy
â€¢ Text a accountability partner
â€¢ Do 10 pushups or jumping jacks
â€¢ Keep a lemon wedge to bite
â€¢ Visualize your health goals

DELAY for 15 minutes and it will PASS.
thinkingRelapsing_tip17:
INSULIN RESISTANCE develops from
chronic sugar consumption.

RESET YOUR METABOLISM:
â€¢ Apple cider vinegar before meals
â€¢ 12-hour overnight fast
â€¢ Cinnamon in coffee or tea
â€¢ Short high-intensity workouts
â€¢ Berberine supplement (nature's metformin)

INCREASED SENSITIVITY = REDUCED CRAVINGS.
thinkingRelapsing_tip18:
Your BRAIN uses 25% of your energy
but GLUCOSE ISN'T ITS ONLY FUEL.

SUPPORT BRAIN HEALTH with:
â€¢ Healthy fats like MCT oil
â€¢ Omega-3 rich foods (salmon, walnuts)
â€¢ Lion's mane mushroom
â€¢ Alpha-GPC or choline
â€¢ Regular cardiovascular exercise

A WELL-FED BRAIN doesn't crave sugar.
thinkingRelapsing_tip19:
SOCIAL ENVIRONMENTS trigger
87% of diet RELAPSES.

STRATEGIES FOR SOCIAL SETTINGS:
â€¢ Eat protein before events
â€¢ Bring a sugar-free dish to share
â€¢ Hold a sparkling water with lime
â€¢ Have a prepared response for offers
â€¢ Partner with a sugar-free friend

PREPARATION makes social pressure MANAGEABLE.
thinkingRelapsing_tip20:
MINDLESS EATING accounts for
most sugar consumption.

PRACTICE MINDFULNESS with:
â€¢ Eat without screens
â€¢ Chew each bite 20 times
â€¢ Set a timer for 20 minutes per meal
â€¢ Use smaller plates
â€¢ Ask: 'Am I actually hungry?'

AWARENESS is the first step to CHANGE.

successStory1_story: I used to drink 3-4 sodas every day. Just three days with STOPPR, and I'm already feeling less anxious about giving up sweet drinks. The cravings tracker is helping me understand my patterns.
successStory2_story: As a stress eater, I always reached for candy. Five days into STOPPR, I'm starting to recognize my triggers. The breathing exercises are getting me through the toughest moments.
successStory3_story: First day without sugar and I'm surviving! The panic button already saved me from caving at lunchtime. Taking it hour by hour, but STOPPR makes me feel like I can do this!
successStory4_story: My doctor warned me about prediabetes, so I had to act. After just a week with STOPPR, I'm noticing my energy levels are more stable. The daily check-ins keep me accountable.
successStory5_story: As a baker, I'm surrounded by sweets all day. Ten days with STOPPR has helped me start maintaining professional taste testing without binging afterward. Small victories!
successStory6_story: Only 48 hours sugar-free but already proud of myself! The breathing exercises on STOPPR got me through some intense cravings yesterday. My skin already seems less inflamed!
successStory7_story: I used to get terrible headaches from sugar crashes. Two weeks with STOPPR, and the frequency has already decreased! I'm starting to have consistent energy throughout the day.
successStory8_story: After many failed attempts, STOPPR is finally helping me quit sugar. Three weeks in, and the daily check-ins and community support make all the difference. My grandkids are noticing!
successStory9_story: As a fitness instructor, I was hiding a secret sugar addiction. Today is my first day with STOPPR, and I already feel more honest with myself. The pledge feature gave me that push I needed.
successStory10_story: The pledge feature helped me commit to quitting sugar. One week in, and I'm starting to feel more in control. The daily support is helping me tackle this addiction one day at a time.
successStory11_story: I was skeptical that an app could help, but after just 4 days with STOPPR, I'm starting to understand my relationship with sugar better. The brain rewiring concepts make so much sense!
successStory12_story: Sugar was my way of dealing with work stress. Nearly a week with STOPPR has helped me recognize this pattern and start finding alternatives. Already had my first sugar-free workday!
successStory13_story: After my diabetes diagnosis, I needed help. Almost two weeks with STOPPR's daily structure and positive reinforcement is making the impossible seem possible. My morning glucose is improving!
successStory14_story: Just two days in, and the achievements system in STOPPR has turned my sugar-free journey into a game I'm determined to win. Made it through donut day at the office â€“ that's huge for me!
successStory15_story: Living in a city famous for sweet treats, breaking free from sugar seemed impossible. Five days with STOPPR has given me tools to navigate my first social events while staying committed.
successStory16_story: I used to think my sweet tooth was just part of who I was. Nine days in, I'm realizing it's an addiction I can overcome. STOPPR is guiding me through the process one craving at a time.
successStory17_story: As someone with PCOS, reducing sugar is crucial. One week with STOPPR has made it manageable with practical strategies. The cravings are tough but getting more manageable each day!
successStory18_story: I never realized how much brain fog was caused by sugar until I started quitting with STOPPR's help. Two weeks in, my thinking is starting to clear up and I'm more focused at work.
successStory19_story: The community feature on STOPPR connected me with others going through the same struggles. Their support has helped me push through these first three difficult days of withdrawal.
successStory20_story: Working night shifts, I relied heavily on sugary snacks. Four days with STOPPR has helped me start finding healthier alternatives. Had my first sugar-free shift yesterday and still had energy!

relapsedScreen_infoText: Relapsing can be tough and make you feel awful, but it's crucial not to be too hard on yourself. Doing so can create a vicious cycle, as explained below.
relapsedScreen_cycleStep1_description: In the moment of consumption, you experience an intense pleasure and satisfaction.
relapsedScreen_cycleStep2_description: Shortly after the initial high, your energy levels plummet, leaving you with fatigue, brain fog, and regret.
relapsedScreen_cycleStep3_description: You reach for more sugar to alleviate the crash, perpetuating the cycle. If you don't break this pattern, it becomes increasingly difficult to stop.
relapsedScreen_strengthMessage: Your strength is proven in your ability to overcome addiction.
relapsedScreen_teamBeliefMessage: You got this, the STOPPR team believes in you ðŸ’™

foodAlternatives_nutrientInfoTip: Tap the (i) icon on each nutrient for more details!
nutrient_calories_explanation: Calories measure the energy in food. Consuming too many can lead to weight gain. This alternative aims for a more balanced energy intake.
nutrient_carbs_explanation: Carbohydrates are a primary energy source. Refined carbs can spike blood sugar. This alternative focuses on complex carbs or fewer carbs for better energy levels.
nutrient_protein_explanation: Protein is crucial for building muscle and feeling full. This alternative often provides more protein to support satiety and muscle maintenance.
nutrient_fat_explanation: Fats are essential, but unhealthy fats (saturated, trans) can harm heart health. This alternative prioritizes healthier fats (unsaturated) for better well-being.
nutrient_sugar_explanation: Excess sugar intake is linked to many health issues like weight gain and diabetes. This alternative significantly reduces added sugars for better health.
nutrient_fiber_explanation: Fiber aids digestion, helps control blood sugar, and promotes fullness. This alternative often increases fiber content for improved gut health and satiety.
foodAlternatives_nutrientWarning: âš ï¸ Heads up! A {percentage} {change} in {nutrientName}.
foodAlternatives_giExplanation: The Glycemic Index (GI) ranks foods based on how quickly they raise blood sugar levels after eating. Foods with a lower GI value are digested and absorbed slower, leading to a more gradual rise in blood sugar.
foodAlternatives_giLowDescription: Slower sugar release, better for stable energy.
foodAlternatives_giMediumDescription: Moderate impact on blood sugar levels.
foodAlternatives_giHighDescription: Rapid sugar spike, may lead to energy crashes.

panicEatSalty_subtitle: Small portion, no bread, no sugar, not too industrial.

panicModal_water_description: Two glasses of water reduces sugar cravings by rehydrating your body and easing hunger signals often mistaken for sugar needs.
panicModal_chocolate_description: 90% dark chocolate gives a rich, bitter taste that satisfies sweet urges without spiking blood sugar or triggering more cravings.
panicModal_tea_description: Drinking hot tea calms your mind, fills your stomach, and replaces the urge for sugar with a warm, comforting ritual.
panicModal_exercise_description: Just 2 minutes of exercise boosts mood and energy, reduces stress, and distracts your brain from wanting sugary rewards.
panicModal_brushTeeth_description: Brushing your teeth can signal the end of eating, refresh your mouth, and make sugary foods taste less appealing.
panicModal_salty_description: Eating a small portion of salty food can help neutralize sugar cravings by providing a contrasting taste and satisfying mineral needs.
panicModal_highProtein_description: An isolated protein shake or Greek yogurt provides pure protein that stabilizes blood sugar, reduces hunger hormones, and prevents sugar cravings for hours.
panicHighProtein_subtitle: Stabilize your blood sugar and crush cravings
panicModal_fruitsFiber_description: One apple or a cup of berries provides natural fiber that slows sugar absorption, satisfies your sweet tooth naturally, and keeps you full longer.
panicModal_lemonWater_description: Squeeze half a lemon in cold water to create a tangy drink that hydrates, detoxifies, and interrupts sugar cravings with its bright, citrus flavor.
panicLemonWater_subtitle: Refresh and reset with citrus power
panicModal_appleVinegar_description: A small sip of apple cider vinegar mixed with water creates a sharp, tangy taste that instantly interrupts sugar cravings and helps regulate blood sugar levels.
panicAppleVinegar_subtitle: Sharp reset for instant craving control
panicModal_coldSparklingWater_descriptio: Cold sparkling water provides refreshing carbonation that creates a feeling of fullness, hydrates your body, and gives your mouth a satisfying sensory experience without sugar.
panicModal_stepBurst_description: Take 200-300 quick steps indoors to boost endorphins, increase heart rate, and shift your focus away from sugar cravings with this mini movement burst.
panicModal_visualizationScript_title: Ride the Urge with Mind Power
panicModal_visualizationScript_descripti: Read this 30-second script to yourself: 'This craving is just a wave. I watch it rise, peak, and fall. I am stronger than this temporary feeling. My health matters more than this moment. I choose my future self.'
panicVisualizationScript_subtitle: 30 seconds of self-talk to ride the urge
panicModal_burpees_description: 5 quick burpees activate your entire body, flood your system with endorphins, and completely shift your mental state away from sugar cravings through intense physical engagement.
panicBurpees_subtitle: Full-body blast to crush the craving
panicModal_quickNap_description: A quick 10-20 minute nap helps restore energy when you're tired from poor sleep, preventing your body from seeking energy through sugar cravings.
panicModal_coldHotShower_description: Taking a shower disrupts boredom patterns and provides sensory stimulation that helps break the cycle of mindless eating and sugar cravings while refreshing your entire mindset.
panicColdHotShower_subtitle: Break boredom and refresh your mind
panicModal_mintGum_description: Sugar-free mint gum provides a strong menthol sensation that cleanses your palate, satisfies the oral fixation, and resets your taste buds away from sugar cravings.

prePaywall_review1_text: STOPPR changed my life! After 3 weeks, I no longer crave sugar and my energy levels are through the roof. The daily challenges keep me motivated and accountable.
prePaywall_review2_text: I've tried everything to quit sugar. STOPPR is the only app that actually worked. The science-based approach and community support made all the difference.
prePaywall_review3_text: Down 15 pounds and feeling amazing! The app taught me to rewire my brain and now I genuinely prefer healthy foods. Best investment I've made for my health.
prePaywall_review4_text: The panic button feature saved me countless times. When cravings hit, the app gives me instant tools to redirect my thoughts. Absolutely life-changing.
prePaywall_review5_text: My skin cleared up, my mood stabilized, and I sleep better than ever. STOPPR didn't just help me quit sugar - it gave me my life back.
prePaywall_review6_text: The educational content is incredible. I finally understand why I was addicted to sugar and how to break free. 90 days clean and counting!
prePaywall_review7_text: I was skeptical at first, but STOPPR delivered results beyond my expectations. My focus improved dramatically and I feel mentally sharper than ever.
prePaywall_review8_text: The community support is incredible! Having people who understand the struggle makes all the difference. 60 days sugar-free and loving life.
prePaywall_review9_text: STOPPR helped me break a 20-year sugar addiction. The personalized plan and daily reminders kept me on track when willpower wasn't enough.
prePaywall_review10_text: My athletic performance skyrocketed after quitting sugar with STOPPR. Stable energy, better recovery, and no more afternoon crashes. Game changer!

foodScan_bloodSugarExplanation: Stable blood sugar levels are key for consistent energy, better mood, and long-term health. Frequent spikes and crashes can lead to fatigue, cravings, and increased risk of metabolic issues over time. Choosing foods with lower impact helps keep your energy steady and supports overall well-being.
mealTiming_description: When you eat can affect blood sugar just as much as *what* you eat! ðŸ•’ Different times impact metabolism differently.

calorieTracker_healthScore_info_copy: Your daily health score ranges from 0 to 10. Carbs have a strong impact: above 50g carbs in a day is considered bad, and above 100g is terrible. This can be mitigated if you move or work out more â€” more activity reduces the penalty. We also consider sugar negatively, and fiber positively.

calorieTracker_bmi_info:
As with most measures of health, BMI is not a perfect test. For example, results can be thrown off by pregnancy or high muscle mass, and it may not be a good measure of health for children or the elderly.

So then, why does BMI matter?

In general, the higher your BMI, the higher the risk of developing a range of conditions linked with excess weight, including diabetes, arthritis, liver disease, several types of cancer (such as those of the breast, colon, and prostate), high blood pressure (hypertension), high cholesterol, sleep apnea.

fasting_info_body:
Intermittent fasting is a structured pause from eating that can improve how your body handles glucose and hunger signals. By extending the time between meals, insulin levels fall, which supports fat burning and helps cells become more insulinâ€‘sensitive.

Blood sugar: Periods without food reduce postâ€‘meal glucose spikes and allow insulin to return to baseline. Over time, studies show improved insulin sensitivity and lower fasting glucose in many people. More stable blood sugar often means steadier energy and fewer afternoon crashes.

Hunger hormones: Ghrelin (the 'I'm hungry' signal) tends to adapt with consistent fasting windows, which many people experience as fewer random cravings. Meanwhile, satiety hormones such as leptin can work more effectively when meals are timed consistently.

Metabolic flexibility: Fasting encourages your body to switch between using glucose and stored fat for fuel. This flexibility is associated with better lipid profiles and easier weight management in some individuals.

Cellular housekeeping: Longer fasts can promote autophagyâ€”your cells' natural cleanâ€‘up processâ€”supporting cellular repair. This is an emerging area of research and should be approached gradually and sensibly.

How to start: Pick a realistic eating window (for example 12:12 or 14:10) and be consistent for 1â€“2 weeks. Hydrate well, prioritize protein and fiber at meals, and break your fast gently.

Safety: Fasting isn't for everyone. Do not fast if you are pregnant, underweight, have a history of eating disorders, are on glucoseâ€‘lowering medications without medical supervision, or if your clinician has advised against it. Always listen to your body and consult a healthcare professional if unsure.
